description: The performance is too poor on Debian 11, Gnome
Ok, so there is a scattered dot pencil tool, and some selection functionality, etc, but an image editor needs a lot more serious tools before calling itself an image editor.
It has a selection tool that does nothing. The pencil tool can't draw a line without leaving gaps in between.

This image editor does not do much and has plenty of bugs. Drawing a simple line on an image is impossible, it just draws a series of dots more or less spaced apart depending on the speed of your cursor.
